results.title: State of the art. Part 2: Value
results.brief_description: VALUE: On a journey through the art world in Germany and the United States, the film asks two closely related questions. How does a work of art acquire its aesthetic worth - who decided today whether it is good or not? And how does it gain financial worth - who says one canvas is worth more than a fortune and another next to nothing?

results.title: State of the art. Part 1: History
results.brief_description: Beginning in the frenetic, image-swamped ‘post-modern’ world of today, the film examines the work of four artists who look to the past to make sense of the present and the future.

results.title: State of shock
results.brief_description: Alwyn Peter is an Aboriginal man who, with his people, was removed in 1963 at the age of six from his home at Mapoon, North Queensland. The land was to be used for a bauxite mine that never eventuated. Their homes were burnt and their possessions were destroyed. Alwyn’s story is a story of a community riven by alcohol-driven violence and marked by self-mutilation. It is also a story of resilience, particularly on the part of the women. Beyond prejudices or well intentioned rhetoric, David Bradbury depicts a community experiencing systematic annihilation by its own hand as dispossession and loss of identity conspire with alcohol abuse to create a murder rate of genocidal proportions.

results.title: State aid for the needy
results.brief_description: Social aid to the people of Fribourg is adminstered under the Federal Social Aid Law. This provides financial assistance to those whose income is below the specified basic income. Assists in vocational education of normal and physically handicapped children, provides accommodation and entertainment for the aged, nurseries for the children of working mothers, as well as financial and domestic aid to young mothers.

results.title: Starting your own business. Parts. 1-3
results.creator_credit: Ron Tanner, Lloyds Bank and Millbank Films
results.brief_description: Designed to forewarn those considering self-employment that there is no easy recipe for success and relates the stories of three people who decided to be their own boss. Highlights basic business pointers and identifies the problems and pitfalls of going solo.

results.title: Starting to read: ducks
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of ducks on a farm to introduce such words and concepts as big, small, walk, feet, water and eat. Superimposes the words on the picture and uses a song to intorduce the words being studied. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels

results.title: Stars and galaxies (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media International
results.brief_description: World renowned star photographer David Maitland of the Anglo-Australian Observatory, along with others reveal the universe in brilliant colour. The evolution of a star in a gaseous nebulae through to the final stages of its life as a white dwarf, supernova, pulsar or black hole. Additional sequences trace the history of astronomy and the development of optical and radio telescopes. This CD provides excellent information for teaching about Astronomy in the classroom.

results.title: Starlife (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Traces the long evolution of a star from its birth in the depths of black nebula to its final extinction. Based on photographs taken with highly sophisticated instruments, animated drawings which propel the audience through the vast spaces of the universe, and bombard the eye with extra-terrestrial imagery of great beauty.
